item.title: By: lievenlb
item.dc:creator: lievenlb
item.description: Thanks Dan! Will check it out. As to Demaine-O'Rourke I trust you mean <a href="https://erikdemaine.org/papers/GFALOP/" rel="nofollow ugc">this book</a>.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Dan! Will check it out. As to Demaine-O’Rourke I trust you mean this book.

item.title: By: Dan Fox
item.dc:creator: Dan Fox
item.description:
Origami.
There are books of Robert Lang "Twists, Tilings, Tessellations", Thomas Hull "Origametry", and Erik Demaine and Joseph O'Rourke (I forget the title), as well as one just by O'Rourke "How to fold it" (something like that). In addition to Lang, who is somehow the archon of the area, another good proselytizer is L. Mahadevan (students like videos! both these guys have some good videos).
item.content:encoded:
Origami.

There are books of Robert Lang “Twists, Tilings, Tessellations”, Thomas Hull “Origametry”, and Erik Demaine and Joseph O’Rourke (I forget the title), as well as one just by O’Rourke “How to fold it” (something like that). In addition to Lang, who is somehow the archon of the area, another good proselytizer is L. Mahadevan (students like videos! both these guys have some good videos).
